content:
With reference to the forum comment here ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-haunted-manor/1421/33 ):

> What is actually given is the number of times we see monsters, not how many monsters we see.

I'd like to suggest you to amend the wording in both Goal section and Input section to avoid potential confusion. Currently, the phrasing might lead readers to interpret it as the total number of monsters visible, rather than the total number of times monsters appear in view (whether directly or in a mirror). As pointed out in the same comment, the distinction is important.

In addition, it'll be helpful to make the distinction even clearer by adding an explanation in Goal section, similar to the one provided here ( https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/puzzles/doc/undead.html#undead ):

> If your reflected line of sight crosses the same monster more than once, the number will count it each time it is visible, not just once.

Thanks.

Nice puzzle : )

Problem : There is an Inconsistency between constraints and test cases...

    Constraint :  3 ≤ size ≤ 7
    Cases : "Not much of a manor" (both Test and Validator) are of size < 3

Problem : Possible missing information?

    - Problem Statement doesn't say that there is always 1 (and only 1) solution
    - It also doesn't tell you how to choose between two possible solutions.

    I believe that that the statement should normally say one of these two things.  If there
    is only 1 possible solution, say so ... if there might be more than one, you need to
    indicate which solution to return (example: 'the one that comes first, alphabetically')

Very minor issues, but  they should probably be addressed : )

I'm confused by the example in the statement. Looking from the bottom left or  bottom middle window, I understand two ghosts and two zombies should be visible, with one of each reflected in a mirror, which would make the input 442 instead of 332.
What am I missing?

Ghosts can only be seen through a mirror.
Take the bottom left window, you can see the first zombie, but not the ghost behind it. Then you hit a mirror and gain the ability to see ghosts from that point. Then you see a ghost and a zombie.
So you see 3 monsters.

I'm sorry if my statement is unclear :(

No it's clear, just me not thinking straight :)

Thank you.
